input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.

format.description: What format is the samplesheet in? (csv/json).

scorefile.description: Path to a scoring file in PGS Catalog format. Multiple scorefiles can be specified using wildcards (e.g., --scorefile "path/to/scores/*.txt")

pgs_id.description: A comma separated list of PGS score IDs, e.g. PGS000802.

pgp_id.description: A comma separated list of PGS Catalog publications, e.g. PGP000001.

efo_id.description: A comma separated list of PGS Catalog EFO traits, e.g. EFO_0004214.

target_build.description: Genome build of target genomes(*GRCh38*, GRCh37).

projection_method.description: The method for PCA prediction. oadp: most accurate. adp: accurate but slow. sp: fast but inaccurate (*oadp*, sp, adp).

ancestry_method.description: Method used for population/ancestry assignment (*RandomForest*, Mahalanobis).

ref_label.description: Population labels in reference psam to use for assignment, e.g. SuperPop.

n_popcomp.description: Number of PCs used for population assignment, e.g. 5.

normalization_method.description: Method used for normalisation of genetic ancestry (*empirical mean mean+var*, empirical, mean, mean+var).

n_normalization.description: Number of PCs used for population normalisation, e.g. 4.

load_afreq.description: Load allelic frequencies from reference panel when scoring target genomes, e.g. True

pca_maf_target.description: Minimum MAF threshold in TARGET samples for variants to be included in the PCA, e.g. 0.

pca_geno_miss_target.description: Maximum genotype missingness threshold in TARGET samples for variants to be included in the PCA, e.g. 0.1.
